content.webTitle: Boss leaves as troubled lottery sells shares at 5p

fields.headline: Boss leaves as troubled lottery sells shares at 5p
fields.bodyText: Tim Holley, the chairman of online lottery operator Chariot, and two of his management team have departed in the wake of a financial crisis at the group, which floated two months ago. Chariot, which operates the charity-focused lottery Monday as a competitor to the National Lottery, was forced to seek further funds after selling just 1.7m tickets in its first four weeks. The company yesterday said it had raised £2.7m through a placing of 53m shares at 5p, which would ease working capital concerns. Chariot said it would reduce costs and seek greater marketing support from its 70 charity partners.
